extendedIngredients.name: baby arugula leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 tightly packed cups baby kale leaves

extendedIngredients.name: fresh herbs
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons fresh herbs, minced (I recommend a mixture of basil, oregano and parsley)
metaInformation: (I recommend a mixture of basil, oregano and parsley)

extendedIngredients.name: mushrooms
extendedIngredients.originalString: 16 ounces of mushrooms, cut into slices

extendedIngredients.name: tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups chopped tomatoes (I used 10 Campari tomatoes cut into quarters)

extendedIngredients.name: yellow onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 small yellow onion, sliced into thin half moons

recipes.title: One Pan Quinoa with Ground Turkey, Kale, Mushrooms, Tomatoes
recipes.instructions: In a large high-sided skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add turkey and onions and season with salt and pepper. Break up the turkey and cook until turkey is cooked through and brown.Remove turkey and onions to a bowl and add mushrooms to pan. (You can do this in batches as well if need be to get them nice and brown.)Saut mushrooms until golden brown and cooked. Add tomatoes and kale and cook until kale is wilted.Increase heat to medium high and turkey and onion mixture back in. Add wine.Bring to a boil and cook until wine is reduced by about half.Reduce heat to medium-low and stir in quinoa and herbs. Continue to cook until warmed through, serve with freshly grated parmesan cheese.

steps.step: In a large high-sided skillet, heat oil over medium heat.
Add turkey and onions and season with salt and pepper. Break up the turkey and cook until turkey is cooked through and brown.
Remove turkey and onions to a bowl and add mushrooms to pan. (You can do this in batches as well if need be to get them nice and brown.)Saut mushrooms until golden brown and cooked.
Add tomatoes and kale and cook until kale is wilted.Increase heat to medium high and turkey and onion mixture back in.

Add wine.Bring to a boil and cook until wine is reduced by about half.Reduce heat to medium-low and stir in quinoa and herbs. Continue to cook until warmed through, serve with freshly grated parmesan cheese.
